subject: Re: JUnit, ANT, log4j, System.out issue

messageBody:
After posting to the ANT users list, somebody there suggested the
problem may be in log4j's ConsoleAppender. Indeed, it appears that
the ConsoleAppender in log4j saves a reference to System.out. Since
the log4j configuration happens before the JUnit task redirects the
System.out stream, the log messages are lost.

One potential work-arounds for this is writing a custom version of
ConsoleAppender that does not cache the value of System.out. A second
work-around suggested was configuring the appender programatically
after start up.

In addition, I went to log a bug with log4j and discovered that the
issue was already logged. I added a note to that bug to detail the
effect it had on the combination of JUnit, ANT and log4j. This bug
had had no activity since being posted, so if this issue effects you
as well, you may want to post a note to the bug or to the log4j-dev
list to let people know it is a priority.

Resources:

Thread on ant-user list:
http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=ant-user&m=111178627603846&w=2

http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=31056

Ray
